HOMEPAGE_DESCRIPTION: We get itâ€”scheduling between people sucks. Scalander is a digital meeting scheduling tool that fixes scheduling: once and for all. It's as easy as telling us who is showing up; we will handle the rest.
DATETIMERANGEPICKER_SELECT_DATE: Select a date on the left!
SCHEDULE_DESCRIPTION: Someone has invited you to pick a time for a meeting. Let's find time for the meeting together!
SCHEDULE_CONGRATS_MSG: Thank you very much for submitting your availability. We will reach out soon by email with the details of the scheduled event. See you soon!
MEETING_PRIORITY: Enter the participants' email. A higher priority score means we will preferentially respect their schedule.
MEETING_LOADING: Working hard with the scheduling bots...
MEETING_DONE: Done! Each invitee will get an email with futher instructions.
MEETING_NOT_SCHEDULED: We have not yet identified a viable time for this meeting. Keep your eyes peeled on this page!
FAQ_ONE_ANSWER: We only store the times when you are available, and we don't store any data relating to what you are doing when you are unavailable.
FAQ_TWO: How do you keep my account and meeting data safe?
FAQ_TWO_ANSWER: All your data is stored at Google data centers using industry-standard security practices.
FAQ_THREE: How does this weight thing work?
FAQ_THREE_ANSWER: For each potential meeting time, the cumulative sum of all the weights determines which times we prioritize over others. For example, if there are two people with a weight of 2 and one person with a weight of 5, a time that only has the higher weighted attendee would be prioritized over a time with both lower weighted attendees.
FAQ_FOUR: Shouldn't it be scalendar instead of scalander?
